The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

if you love trpgs but are getting tired of all the great indie devs emulating ogre tactics and ff tactics while wondering where the fire emblem/langrisser love is at then this is your game. It is hands down THE best non-fire emblem game that falls under the latter category of styles and punches so far above its weight class that at one point while playing i idly wondered if they poached an intelligent systems game designer or something (they didnt).

As long as you are aware this is an EARLY ACCESS game and what you are getting is no where near the final product, Ilysia is a great game and easily worth the $15. Yes, some things are very poor at the moment and there is a lot of room for improvement, but thats the point of EA. Give Team21 a chance to make Ilysia the incredible VR MMO it is destined to be.

Game "sweet and sad" at the same time. There are decisions you have to make to survive but also take into account everything behind killing an animal. It would be nice if it were enriched with content in the future. 7/10 my rating

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The gameplay might be standard affair for an RPGmaker horror game. But this game avoids the usual pitfalls by keeping areas small and full of flavour text from the two lovable and deranged protagonists. My only complaint is that the music can be repetitive and, when that's my only complaint, I know it was money well spent.
TLDR; If you want to be able to go into space and land on a fake moon, then this DLC's for you. However if you care about realism, then do not buy.

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

if you love trpgs but are getting tired of all the great indie devs emulating ogre tactics and ff tactics while wondering where the fire emblem/langrisser love is at then this is your game. Yes, some things are very poor at the moment and there is a lot of room for improvement, but thats the point of EA. Give Team21 a chance to make Ilysia the incredible VR MMO it is destined to be.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

The biggest weakness of the game is that it is built on a significantly older branch of the Stellaris engine, with a lot of aspects and issues that Stellaris itself simply doesn't have. It's a fun twist on Stellaris, has a nice Star Trek coat of paint, but it'll only become great if it is polished and fixed up over time.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

The biggest weakness of the game is that it is built on a significantly older branch of the Stellaris engine, with a lot of aspects and issues that Stellaris itself simply doesn't have. It's a fun twist on Stellaris, has a nice Star Trek coat of paint, but it'll only become great if it is polished and fixed up over time.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. The biggest weakness of the game is that it is built on a significantly older branch of the Stellaris engine, with a lot of aspects and issues that Stellaris itself simply doesn't have. It's a fun twist on Stellaris, has a nice Star Trek coat of paint, but it'll only become great if it is polished and fixed up over time.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

The biggest weakness of the game is that it is built on a significantly older branch of the Stellaris engine, with a lot of aspects and issues that Stellaris itself simply doesn't have. Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

The biggest weakness of the game is that it is built on a significantly older branch of the Stellaris engine, with a lot of aspects and issues that Stellaris itself simply doesn't have. It's a fun twist on Stellaris, has a nice Star Trek coat of paint, but it'll only become great if it is polished and fixed up over time.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

The biggest weakness of the game is that it is built on a significantly older branch of the Stellaris engine, with a lot of aspects and issues that Stellaris itself simply doesn't have. It's a fun twist on Stellaris, has a nice Star Trek coat of paint, but it'll only become great if it is polished and fixed up over time.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The game is very good. I am however extremely dissapointed with the co-op. They said multiple times leading up to the release that you can play the whole game with a friend. You can *technically* do that, but onle the host gets story and boss progress, special items, spells, and the biggest sinner of all, boss loot/rememberence. The coop was the biggest reason me and my friend was excited about the game, because we love souls like games, but hate the way From Software designs their coop. If you're only getting this to play with a friend, don't. If you're getting this to play a really good souls like by yourself, absolutely get it

Somewhat of a rocky start but overall, it's not been horrible. There was some issues getting the game to launch but after figuring that black screen problem out, it's all been smooth. The graphics are great and the ambient sounds honestly do a great job of making it feel like you're sitting in the lower decks of a ship sometimes. A lot could be added to the game, and although I'm sure the devs will be continuing to work on things, the fact that modding is supported is huge for the longevity of the game. Overall, there is a lot of potential for this to take off. I'd say it's already worth the $30 and it certainly will keep it's value moving forward.

if you love trpgs but are getting tired of all the great indie devs emulating ogre tactics and ff tactics while wondering where the fire emblem/langrisser love is at then this is your game. It is hands down THE best non-fire emblem game that falls under the latter category of styles and punches so far above its weight class that at one point while playing i idly wondered if they poached an intelligent systems game designer or something (they didnt).

As long as you are aware this is an EARLY ACCESS game and what you are getting is no where near the final product, Ilysia is a great game and easily worth the $15. Yes, some things are very poor at the moment and there is a lot of room for improvement, but thats the point of EA. Give Team21 a chance to make Ilysia the incredible VR MMO it is destined to be.

The biggest weakness of the game is that it is built on a significantly older branch of the Stellaris engine, with a lot of aspects and issues that Stellaris itself simply doesn't have. It's a fun twist on Stellaris, has a nice Star Trek coat of paint, but it'll only become great if it is polished and fixed up over time.

Here is the complete truth about the new DLC. The graphics are now quite a but worse, I wouldn't say "Roblox graphics" but definitely worse. The air pressure system needs a patch, but the moon and the other space stuff seems to work well. They changed the rocket engines, so they have to be replaced on every creation that uses them like missiles for example. They also fixed the pivot glitch, a very common way people made boats/submarines float in Stormworks is by putting pivots on the bottom of them, now that doesn't work so most water vehicles don't float as well if at all. The Stormworks devs have been working on this DLC for years, so they didn't do it for purely the money, but I would still wait a month or two before getting this DLC.
The price is only worth it if you desperately love this series as much as I do. Have fun :)

The gameplay might be standard affair for an RPGmaker horror game.
